definition: O'Connor (name)/Thomas Power O'Connor (1848-1929), Irish journalist and nationalist political leader
Austria/Austrian/abbr. for 奧地利|奥地利[Ao4 di4 li4]/Olympic/Olympics/abbr. for 奧林匹克|奥林匹克[Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4]
to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: Justice O’Connor herself underwent surgery for breast cancer in 1988.
sentences.chinese: 奥康纳大法官在1988年也接受过乳腺癌的手术。

sentences.english: O'Connor, you may also know, has been understood as a religious writer.
sentences.chinese: 你们也许知道奥康纳一直以来，被视为一位宗教作家。

sentences.english: In nineteen seventy-one, O'Connor's "Collected Stories" was published.
sentences.chinese: 在一九七一年，奥康纳的“收集的故事”出版。

sentences.english: "It matched our predictions really well, " O'Connor says.
sentences.chinese: “这恰恰跟我们的预测相吻合，”奥康纳说。

sentences.english: O’Connor has participated in a few of Wansink’s pilot programs.
sentences.chinese: 奥康纳参与了一些汪幸科的试点项目。

sentences.english: The repugnancy of O’Connor’s characters is, in her portrayal, connected to their poverty and backwardness.
sentences.chinese: 奥康纳小说里角色的丑陋性和贫穷落后有关。

sentences.english: This is very typical in tone for O'Connor.
sentences.chinese: 这是典型的奥康纳语气。

sentences.english: Flannery O'Connor, as most of you probably know, is a Southern writer.
sentences.chinese: 正如大家所知，弗兰纳里，奥康纳是个南方作家。

definition: becquerel (unit of radioactivity, symbol Bq)/abbr. for 貝克勒爾|贝克勒尔[bei4 ke4 le4 er3]
Burns (name)/Nicholas Burns (1956-), US diplomat, Under-secretary at US State Department from 2005
